title: Codice Fiscale
information: The Codice Fiscale is a tax code unique to each person. It is required for many things, including getting a Permesso di Soggiorno, signing the contract with the academy or with your landlord, or even for joining a gym.

steps.title: Book an appointment
steps.text:
Book an appointment either online or through the app. If you can't make the appointment, remember to cancel it. Note that the English and German versions of the website are different to the Italian one.
Book or cancel an appointment on the website: 
Use the translate service built into Safari or Google Translate to navigate the booking. 

 [Book Appointment](https://prenotazioneweb.agenziaentrate.gov.it/PrenotazioneWeb/prenotazione.action)

steps.text:
Download and fill out the form:

[Editable PDF - English](https://www.agenziaentrate.gov.it/portale/documents/20143/278995/Form+AA48+Editable_AA4_8_Modello_ING.pdf/e32d806e-92e3-05a5-37ac-ab270ff86a74)

Required documents:
 - Completed form 
- Letter of invitation from Academy (Non-EU) 
- ID (Non-EU) 
- Passport 
- Valid visa (if applicable) 
- ID (EU): 
- Passport/Passport card 
- Photocopy of passport/passport card 
- Photocopy of visa (Non-EU)

title: Permesso di Soggiorno
information: Permesso di Soggiorno (temporary residence permit) gives permission for non-EU citizens to stay legally in Italy if they intend to live here for more than three months. Since the Academy course lasts longer than three months, it is a requirement. The permit should be requested within 8 work days of arriving to Italy (excluding Sundays and public holidays).

steps.title: Obtain a KIT
steps.text:
You will first need to go to the Post Office. Ask for the KIT GIALLO for the Permesso di Soggiorno, which consists of an envelope, two forms and a blank receipt (Ricevuta di Accredito). Only one of the forms (Modulo 1) will be needed. The other form (Modulo 2) can be discarded. Not every Post Office has the kit, so it's better to check which Post Office does by searching "Sportello Amico Poste Italiane". The kit is free of charge. There are Post Offices next to the Academy and Central Post Office:

[Post Office near the Academy](https://goo.gl/maps/TNs54py1Hfbtsn7x8)
[Central Post Office](https://goo.gl/maps/z4Jfi1xY8tLPBfnF9)

steps.title: Buy a payment stamp
steps.text: The next step is to buy a revenue stamp, called a "Marca da Bollo". This stamp is commonly used in Italy as a proof of payment. You can get one at a tobacco shop (tabaccheria). For the permesso application it needs to me exactly €16, no more and no less. There is a place for it on the form, but you don't attach it, one of the clerks will. You just take it with you.

steps.title: Fill out the form
steps.text:
There will be 2 questionnaires in the envelope, but you only need to fill out one form - Modulo 1. You need to write in capital letters with a black pen, following the instructions included in the kit. Unfortunately the instructions are in Italian only, so you can check out the useful link below where you will find tips for filling the form out.

[Useful tips for filling out the form](http://expatalexa.com/bureaucracy-tips/fill-permesso-di-soggiorno-step-step-guide/)

steps.title: Fill out the Ricevuta di Accredito
steps.text: Next, on the Ricevuta you need to fill in the Name and Surname, Address, Zip Сode and Сity fields. You need to fill in the main part, as well as the part on the left.

steps.title: Make copies of documents
steps.text:
You will need to make copies of the following documents:
- Passport
- Visa
- Codice Fiscale
- Insurance policy and payment receipt (A receipt may not be necessary, but some people have been asked for one)
- Admission/enrolment letter from the Academy

steps.title: Submit you application through the Post Office
steps.text: The next step is to go to the Post Office again. Bring all the copies that you have made, along with the Marca da Bollo, the completed A4 form from step 3 and the ricevuta from step 4 and give them all to the employee in the window. Then you pay for everything that they tell you (the cost is about €100 euros). After that you get a new ricevuta (DO NOT LOSE THIS). It tells you the date, time and address of your appointment with the police.

steps.title: Go to the Polizia
steps.text:
It is quite common for the appointment to be 1-2 months after submitting your application. You should arrive on the appointed date to [Questura](https://goo.gl/maps/WmZSkN24dExCVog36) (This is the branch that most people have their appointments, but it may be different). Take the following documents with you:
- Ricevuta from Post Office
- Appointment details which was issued along with the second richevuta
- 3x4cm photos (4 photos)
- Passport
- Original insurance policy
- Original Codice Fiscale
- Admission/enrolment letter
- Accommodation contract OR Declaration of Hospitality (Dichiarazione di Ospitalità) from your host or landlord.

Also bring copies of these documents. They shouldn't be required, but just in case. At the police station all the documents will be checked and your fingerprints will be taken. It is better to come to the police 40 minutes in advance, and be sure to take something to eat: you will likely be waiting a very long time.

steps.title: Go to the Polizia again to collect your Permesso
steps.text: About a month after going to the police station, you will receive an SMS saying the permesso is ready to be collected. Go to the same police whenever it is convenient. Collect your card, and start to enjoy life. The most difficult task is over!

title: Mobile operator
information: If you need to get a mobile phone plan while in Italy, here is a list of service providers and MVNOs.

steps.title: Сollect information about mobile operators
steps.text:
Mobile service providers
Service providers build and control their own networks. You'll usually get better quality of service with a provider.

- [Vodafone](https://privati.vodafone.it)
- [Tim](https://www.tim.it/fisso-e-mobile/mobile)
- [Wind Tre](https://www.windtre.it/)
- [Iliad](https://www.iliad.it)
- [Fastweb](https://www.fastweb.it)

MVNOs
MVNOs rent bandwidth from the providers. You might be able to get better deals with an MVNO. If you are concerned with the coverage area of an MVNO, you should check which network it uses. New MVNOs are coming to market all the time, so this list is not exhaustive.

- [Postemobile](http://www.postemobile.it)
- [ho. mobile](https://www.ho-mobile.it)
- [Kena mobile](https://www.kenamobile.it)
- [CoopVoce](https://www.coopvoce.it)
- [Lyca mobile](https://www.lycamobile.it/en)
- [Very Mobile](https://verymobile.it)
- [Spusu](https://www.spusu.it)
- [Optima](https://www.optimaitalia.com)
- [eliMobile](https://elimobile.it)
- [Tiscali](https://casa.tiscali.it/mobile/)

steps.title: Comparing offers
steps.text:
You can look for deals by comparing plans using a site such as [Facile](https://www.facile.it/telefonia/risultati/solo-sim.html?gclid=EAIaIQobChMI6ez38pS4_QIVdo9oCR1sLgDIEAAYAiAAEgJs_vD_BwE).

Coverage
Currently Vodafone has the largest coverage in Italy.

steps.title: Getting a sim card
steps.text:
In order to get a sim card you can go to a carrier's own shop, or a tabacchi or phone shop that has the sim card you are looking for. You will need to bring your passport, EU-issued driver's license or resident's permit. You can also order online, and you will need to provide scans of your ID and a valid postal address.

Topping up
You can top up your sim in most tabacchi, although they tend to use the phrase "charge".
